thread.title: Hockey player viciously attacks official during game
thread.title_full: Hockey player viciously attacks official during game

title: Hockey player viciously attacks official during game
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Hockey player viciously attacks official during game Brutal. Hockey player viciously attacks official during game Brutal. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/hockey-player-ref-official-attacks-levels-junior-college-erie-brandon-day Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Hockey player viciously attacks official during game Andrew Joseph 9:55 p.m. ET Feb. 26, 2017 
Dakota College at Bottineau won Sunday's NJCAA national title game against Erie Community College, but the game came to an unexpected end after a violent outburst from an Erie player. 
Late in the third period, freshman Brandon Day stormed out of the penalty box and went straight for an official, leveling the referee hard to the ice. Erie Community College (NJCAA) player storms out of penalty box to level referee late in 3rd period, ending national title game pic.twitter.com/UuJYjSER3K — Sports Illustrated (@SInow) February 26, 2017 
With Dakota College up, 7-4, officials called the game. 
According to WKBW , Day was taken into custody by the police and was later arrested. I've learned that an Erie County Community College hockey player has been arrested after attacking a referee @WKBW https://t.co/WwgBKG3ghZ — Matthew Bové (@Matt_Bove) February 27, 2017 
Day's outburst came after Erie allowed three straight goals. The final @NJCAA hockey championship was quite wild. @DCB_Athletics defeated @ErieCCAthletics , 7-4, in the title game. #hockey #NJCAA pic.twitter.com/f8xLMUKiU9
